pros: Tenured, dedicated employees. Opportunity to make an impact. Caring team members.

job_title: Director of Activities in Wyckoff, NJ
pros: Great team to work with…in all departments. Family-like atmosphere. I have a wonderful department and I’m appreciative of the team spirit we share. Complimentary meal is a plus.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Wyckoff, NJ
pros: Pay was Exceptionally Great !! Also , With the exception of a little bit of cattiness in the beginning from some CNAS’ who had been there longer than some of us “New Hires” In Which I Put a Stop 2 ASAP ; The Paid On-Site Training & Introduction Into The Nursing Homes & Residents Were Really Great Experiences . This was the very 1st Place I worked where the supervisors , the “higher-ups” were absolutely amazing . I unfortunately had to leave when the pandemic hit the Nursing Home because I am a single mom and needed to stay safe and also quarantine with my kid when her school closed down . I hope some day to return when I feel safe enough to . Being a single mom sometimes you have to think a 4th and 5th time before making your decisions because there’s no room for mistakes . I do miss many , many amazing ppl I met .. especially 1 of my bosses Jennifer .
cons: Sometimes we were understaffed and extra round of residents was extremely tough on Us .

job_title: Evening Utility Worker in Wyckoff, NJ
pros:
-Culture is laid-back. Workers mainly consisted of high school/college students.
-Worked in a kitchen, and was able to get free meals from whatever food was leftover.
cons:
-Lackluster management.  Higher-ups rarely tried to understand what the workers wanted and forced what they think is best, leading to feelings of disdain toward each other.
-Not much room for growth.

pros: They work with your school schedule. Human Resources lady is nice. Buildings look run down and it's making me type minimum 20 words so hi
cons: Low pay. I have an EMT cert and the pay is a set amount regardless of experience. It's 10.50 an hour, I can literally work at Starbucks and not wipe asss for more money. Certified people get 11.75 an hour. Yet as an EMT I can get 15 an hr...  I only went for an interview, clearly didn't take that job. The interview lady also makes you take 110 question quiz agree/disagree thing before you talk to her. Waste of time.
